examples.input: This is an example of a long write with over 10 triplets. The 'Astraeus IX' interstellar colonization ship is a massive vessel, 5 kilometers long, designed for a multi-generational journey to the Kepler-186f system. It houses a crew of 10,000 colonists and 2,000 essential personnel. The ship is powered by a series of advanced fusion reactors providing sustained thrust. Its hull is composed of a multi-layered composite armor, designed to withstand micrometeoroid impacts and cosmic radiation. The interior features a toroidal habitat section that rotates to simulate Earth-like gravity. This habitat contains agricultural domes, residential areas, research labs, and recreational facilities. Navigation is handled by an AI named 'Odysseus', which uses pulsar timing and deep space sensor arrays. Communication with Earth is maintained via a quantum entanglement communicator, though with significant time lag. The ship carries a complement of landers, construction drones, and terraforming equipment. The mission's primary goal is to establish a self-sufficient colony. Secondary goals include detailed study of the Kepler-186f system and search for extraterrestrial life. The project is funded by the 'United Earth Federation'. The launch date is set for 2242. The journey is expected to take 75 years. Dr. Aris Thorne is the mission director. The ship also contains a digital archive of all human knowledge.

Input Question: The 'Global Weather Model NextGen' (GWM-NG) has been deployed by the 'World Meteorological Consortium' (WMC). It improves global forecast accuracy by 15% for 7-day forecasts and 25% for 3-day forecasts. Resolution is now 5km globally, up from 15km. It incorporates real-time data from over 50,000 weather stations, 500 weather buoys, 30 geostationary satellites, and 100 polar-orbiting satellites. Data assimilation uses a 4D-Var technique. Computational power is provided by a new supercomputer 'TerraFlop' capable of 500 PetaFLOPS. The model also predicts air quality and ocean wave heights. Development took 5 years and cost $2 billion. Lead developer was Dr. Anya Sharma. WMC headquarters is in Geneva. GWM-NG replaced the older 'GWM-Classic' model. GWM-Classic had 25km resolution. Public access to GWM-NG forecasts is via a new web portal and API. The portal offers interactive maps. The API is free for research use. Commercial use of API requires a license. License fees fund ongoing model development. WMC has 193 member states. Dr. Sharma previously worked on climate models. The TerraFlop supercomputer uses energy-efficient liquid cooling. GWM-NG also improves hurricane track prediction by 20%. It runs ensemble forecasts with 50 members. Training data for its AI components included 30 years of historical weather data. The model outputs data in NetCDF format. Documentation for API is available on WMC website. WMC provides training workshops for users. The project aims to enhance disaster preparedness globally. GWM-NG also has a module for long-range seasonal outlooks. Seasonal outlooks are updated monthly. The model code is written in Fortran and C++. It undergoes continuous validation against observational data. WMC collaborates with national meteorological services. GWM-NG's public interface supports 10 languages. The data volume generated daily is 5 Petabytes. This data is archived at WMC data centers. Data centers are in three continents. The model considers volcanic ash dispersion. It also models space weather impacts on communication. Dr. Sharma received the 'Gold Medal for Meteorology' for her work. GWM-NG is considered a breakthrough in numerical weather prediction. It helps agriculture by providing better drought forecasts. It also supports aviation with improved turbulence forecasts. The project involved over 200 scientists. The WMC was established in 1950. GWM-NG is part of WMC's 'EarthSystem Prediction Initiative'. The initiative has a budget of $5 billion over 10 years. The new model has reduced false alarm rates for severe weather by 10%.

examples.input: This example of Type 3 has many writes. The 'NovaTerra Corp' has unveiled its comprehensive 'Genesis Project', a multi-stage plan for establishing a permanent, self-sufficient human colony on Mars. Stage 1 involves sending robotic precursor missions to identify optimal landing sites and deploy essential infrastructure, including solar power arrays, water ice extraction units, and habitat modules. These missions will utilize the 'StarLifter' heavy launch vehicle. Stage 2 focuses on the first human crewed landing, with a team of 12 astronauts tasked with assembling the initial base, conducting geological surveys, and initiating small-scale agriculture within pressurized biodomes. The astronauts will live in the pre-deployed habitat modules. Stage 3 involves expanding the colony to 100 inhabitants, establishing larger agricultural facilities, developing in-situ resource utilization (ISRU) capabilities for producing fuel, water, and construction materials from Martian regolith. This stage will also see the construction of a research center focused on Martian geology, astrobiology, and terraforming potential. Stage 4 aims for a population of 1,000 and the development of local manufacturing, including 3D printing of tools and components. The colony, named 'Ares Prime', will strive for Earth independence in critical resources. NovaTerra Corp's CEO, Dr. Aris Thorne, stated the project timeline is 30 years. Ares Prime will have an elected council for governance. The project uses closed-loop life support systems. Water will be recycled with 99% efficiency. Air revitalization uses algae bioreactors. Food production combines hydroponics and aeroponics. The primary energy source will be nuclear fission reactors, supplementing solar. Radiation shielding for habitats uses a combination of Martian regolith and advanced polymers. The StarLifter vehicle can launch 150 tons to LEO. Communication with Earth will use a dedicated network of Martian relay satellites. The estimated total cost is $500 billion, funded by a consortium of private investors and space agencies. NovaTerra is also developing advanced spacesuits for Martian EVAs. These spacesuits offer enhanced mobility and dust protection. The project includes a comprehensive planetary protection protocol to avoid contamination. The colony will feature an advanced medical facility with remote surgery capabilities. Ares Prime will be located near a large subsurface ice deposit in Arcadia Planitia. The first robotic lander is named 'Pathfinder II'. Pathfinder II will carry a ground-penetrating radar. NovaTerra's headquarters is in Houston, Texas. The company has 2,500 employees. The Genesis Project aims to be a stepping stone for further solar system colonization. Dr. Thorne has a background in aerospace engineering and planetary science. The colony's design emphasizes modularity and scalability. Regular cargo resupply missions are planned during the initial stages. The psychological well-being of colonists is a key consideration in habitat design. Ares Prime will have recreational areas and virtual reality facilities. The project has an international advisory board. This board includes experts in science, engineering, and ethics. NovaTerra has partnered with 20 universities for research collaboration. The Martian day (sol) is 24 hours and 39 minutes. Ares Prime will operate on Martian local time. The average temperature on Mars is -63 degrees Celsius. The atmosphere is 95% carbon dioxide. The project will also deploy weather monitoring stations across Mars. Data from these stations will improve Martian climate models. NovaTerra is developing autonomous robots for construction and maintenance tasks. These robots will be AI-controlled. The Genesis Project is considered humanity's most ambitious undertaking.

examples.input: This is a Type 4 (Statement + Question) with many asks. The 'BioForge Array' is a new synthetic biology platform that automates the design, build, and test cycle for engineered microorganisms. It uses AI for pathway design, robotics for DNA assembly and cell culture, and high-throughput screening for performance analysis. It can process 1,000 unique designs per week. Current applications include biofuel production, specialty chemical synthesis, and novel drug discovery. The platform is housed at the 'Institute for Synthetic Life'. What specific AI algorithms are used for pathway design? How does the robotic system ensure sterility during DNA assembly? What types of biosensors are used in the high-throughput screening? What is the average cost per design cycle? Can the platform handle extremophile microorganisms? What data standards are used for design specification and results reporting? How does the BioForge Array address ethical concerns related to synthetic life? What is the success rate for generating functional engineered microorganisms for a typical project? Which specific biofuels have been successfully produced using organisms designed on this platform? How does the platform scale from lab research to industrial production? What intellectual property models apply to designs created on the platform? Are there limitations on the complexity of genetic circuits it can build? What programming languages or design tools are used by researchers to interact with the platform? How long is the typical data retention period for experimental results? What are the future development goals for the BioForge Array?
